title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS — On a night when offense was a premium and defenses dug in, Reggie Miller didn’t just score; he authored a masterpiece against the Miami Heat.

The Indiana Pacers’ sharpshooter delivered a legendary performance, pouring in a game-high 41 points to power his team to a decisive 104-89 victory. While the final score suggests a comfortable win, it was Miller’s singular brilliance that broke the Heat’s will and electrified the home crowd.

From the opening tip, Miller was in a different stratosphere. He attacked from all over the court, finishing an efficient 12-for-22 from the field. But his true dominance came from beyond the arc and at the charity stripe, the two areas he has owned throughout his career. Miller drained five three-pointers and was a perfect 12-for-12 from the free-throw line, a display of clutch shooting that systematically dismantled the Miami defense.

The Heat, who were led by Tim Hardaway’s 22 points, simply had no answer. Whenever Miami threatened to close the gap, Miller would respond with a cold-blooded triple or draw a foul, steadily padding the Pacers’ lead and silencing any momentum.

This was not merely a win; it was a statement delivered through the dead-eye shooting of its franchise icon. Miller’s 41-point outburst transcended the game, ensuring the Pacers’ victory was remembered not for the final margin, but for the historic individual effort that secured it.
